titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Juan Atilio Bramuglia Papers, 1935-1974
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, memoranda, reports, financial records, clippings, other printed matter, and photographs, relating to Argentine foreign relations and participation in the United Nations; political conditions in Argentina, especially the Peronist movement and the Partido Union Popular; and labor policy and legislation in Argentina under the regime of Juan Peron. Includes correspondence with Peron, and some papers of Carlos Atilio Bramuglia.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Juan Atilio Bramuglia Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

chronitem.event: Born, Chascomús, province of Buenos Aires
Receives doctorate in law, University of Buenos Aires
Head of the legal department and counselor, Unión Ferroviaria, an association of railroad employees
Teaches at the faculty of law, University of Buenos Aires
Director of the social welfare department, Secretariat of Work and Welfare
Federal Intervenor, province of Buenos Aires

scopecontent.p: Affidavits, by-laws, cables, charters, charts, circulars, clippings, correspondence, declarations, directives, election material, lists, memoranda, minutes, miscellany, platforms, press releases, proceedings, programs, and reports, concerning a political party of which Bramuglia served as president, arranged alphabetically by physical form. Includes some material relating to Carlos Atilio Bramuglia

did.unittitle: Buenos Aires (Argentina : City), Buenos Aires (Argentina : Province)

scopecontent.p: Albums of clippings documenting Bramuglia's tenure as foreign minister

7 albums of clippings relating to Juan Atilio Bramuglia's tenure as foreign minister, including one (box 19) regarding his participation in the Interamerican Conference for the Maintenance of Continental Peace and Security, Rio de Janeiro, 1947, four (boxes 20-23) concerning his role in the Ninth International American Conference, Bogotá, 1948, and two (boxes 24-25) documenting official visits to Italy and the United Kingdom, 1948
Albums of photographs depicting scenes of Bramuglia's career as foreign minister, as well as his personal residence

Includes some material relating to Carlos Atilio Bramuglia. One album of 11 photographs showing Juan Atilio Bramuglia in the company of Juan Perón, Eva Perón, and President Luis Batlle Beres of Uruguay, and one album of 16 photographs depicting exterior and interior views of the Bramuglia family residence
